item.title: Obligation to report and limits for sellers on Ebay and Etsy
item.description: From February 2023, private sellers will have to deal with a new tax regulation.
item.content:encoded:
Image by SCY on Pixabay

More and more people are using platforms such as Ebay and Etsy to sell used or handmade products. However, starting in February 2023, private sellers will have to deal with a new tax regulation. The Platform Tax Transparency Law (PStTG) was introduced to combat potential tax evasion in private transactions on these platforms. The law requires platforms to report information about profits from private transactions to the tax authorities. Rental platforms such as Airbnb are also affected by this regulation.

Reporting Obligation for Sellers

The new regulations stipulate that sellers who sell more than 30 items per year or earn over 2,000 euros must be reported to the tax authorities by the platform operator. These limits apply per platform. This means that sellers who are active on both Ebay and Etsy must consider both limits separately. The reported information includes names, birthdates, addresses, tax identification numbers, bank details, as well as transactions and sales proceeds.

The tax authorities will check whether sellers have exceeded the defined limits and thus qualify as commercial traders. Attention is paid to whether it involves used items and private sales or if someone regularly and commercially operates on the platforms. Regular rentals of real estate are also considered commercial trade. The main criterion for the tax authorities is the intention to make a profit.

As a seller on platforms like Ebay and Etsy, you should now prepare for possible inquiries from the tax authorities. Accurate documentation can help prove the private nature of your sales. Keep a sales diary in which you record all items with purchase and sale prices. This way, you can demonstrate that these are private sales with no intention of making a profit. It is also important to note that the tax authorities scrutinize more closely if the same goods are sold repeatedly or if items are purchased at a low price and immediately resold at a higher price.

Impact on Sales Prices

The new regulations not only affect sellers but also the platform operators themselves. They are obligated to forward the necessary information to the tax authorities. For this, they must take appropriate measures to collect and store the data of their sellers.

Platforms like Ebay and Etsy have already taken appropriate measures to meet the requirements of the PStTG.

The introduction of the PStTG could also have an impact on sales prices. Some sellers may increase their prices to cover the additional tax obligations. As a result, prices on platforms like Ebay and Etsy could rise overall. Buyers should consider this when making their purchasing decisions and may look for alternatives.

item.title: Amazon voucher cards: Latest legal changes and effects
item.description: In recent months, Amazon has restricted the use of gift cards without any major announcements.
item.content:encoded:
Photo by KRiemer on Pixabay

Source: https://t3n.de/news/amazon-nutzung-gutscheinkarten-eingeschraenkt-gruende-1602166/

Amazon has restricted the use of gift cards in recent months without major announcements. Previously, customers could use them not only for purchases on Amazon but also redeem them with third-party sellers on the Amazon Marketplace. However, customers attempting to pay through a Marketplace seller now receive an annoying error message stating that their gift card balance cannot be used for this order. What is behind this restriction, and why is it problematic for customers?

Legal Changes as the Reason for the Restriction

The reason Amazon gives for this restriction is a legal change in the context of combating money laundering. The EU has stipulated that certain personal data must be collected for transactions. Previously, this only applied to gift cards with a value of 150 euros or more, but in the future, corresponding identification obligations will apply even for lower amounts. While this regulation is still in the development phase, it is assumed that it will be in effect by the year 2025 at the latest.

According to Amazon, laws for payment services require that, in some cases, customers provide identification information when using gift cards for purchases from Amazon partners. However, the company emphasizes that this restriction does not apply to the purchase of products directly from Amazon. Customers can still easily use their gift card balance for Amazon's products and, after confirming their identity, for Marketplace goods.

Impacts on Customers and the Marketplace

This restriction is particularly frustrating for customers who enjoy shopping with Marketplace sellers and want to use their gift card balance. Currently, about two-thirds of Amazon's revenue comes from the Marketplace, while Amazon itself focuses more on trading core products. The Marketplace allows other retailers to offer their products on the platform, providing customers with a wide variety of options.

According to the Retail Association HDE, the previous threshold of 150 euros for collecting personal data has proven successful.

Restrictions and Criticism Regarding the New Regulation

The restriction on the use of gift cards at Amazon is due to a legal change in the context of combating money laundering. Customers can no longer easily redeem their balance with third-party sellers on the Marketplace but only for products directly from Amazon. This restriction is particularly frustrating for customers who enjoy shopping with Marketplace sellers and want to use their gift card balance.

It remains to be seen how the e-money issue surrounding gift cards will develop in the coming months and which regulations will ultimately be adopted by EU bodies. While Amazon, with its payment service Amazon Pay, already has the infrastructure to meet the new requirements, smaller retailers may face challenges in implementation.

Customers wishing to redeem their balance with Marketplace sellers may now have to resort to alternative payment methods. This could lead to a more cumbersome and less flexible purchasing process. Moreover, it is questionable whether the collection of personal data effectively contributes to combating money laundering.

Critics argue that the regulations may be too strict and overlook larger money laundering problems.

Amazon, with its payment service Amazon Pay, already has the infrastructure to meet the new requirements, while smaller retailers may face challenges.

item.title: Everything you need to know about cash on delivery shipping
item.description: Discover why this payment method is the ideal solution for some and can be more of an obstacle for others.
item.content:encoded:
Image: https://pixabay.com/vectors/delivery-online-express-laptop-7070991/

Cash on delivery is a popular payment method in online shopping. More and more people are opting to make their purchases online rather than going to physical stores. This trend has led to the offering of various payment methods, including the "cash on delivery" option.

How does cash on delivery shipping work?

Cash on delivery shipping is simple and straightforward. When placing an order with cash on delivery, you select this payment method at the online store's checkout. The sender specifies the amount that the recipient must pay upon receiving the goods. The goods are then shipped to the recipient.

Upon receiving the shipment, the recipient pays the specified amount directly to the delivery person. Payment is made directly to the delivery person, either in cash or with a debit card.

Pros and Cons

One of the biggest advantages is that the goods are shipped immediately, as the seller does not have to wait for payment to be received. This saves time and allows the customer to receive the goods faster.

Another advantage is security. Since payment occurs upon receipt of the goods, the customer can inspect the shipment and ensure it is in good condition. This is especially important for sensitive documents or valuable items.

In addition, this method is a good option for those who do not have a credit card or online payment options such as PayPal. Payment can be conveniently made in cash or with a debit card.

Although cash on delivery shipping offers many advantages, there are also some disadvantages to consider.

One of them is the additional fee charged for cash on delivery shipping. This fee is added to the price of the goods and must be paid by the recipient. The exact amount of the fee depends on the shipping service provider but is usually at least five euros for domestic orders. Additional surcharges may apply for orders from abroad.

Furthermore, it is necessary for the recipient to be present during delivery to pay for the goods. Delivery to the mailbox or to neighbors is usually not possible. This can be inconvenient if the recipient is not at home and needs to pick up the package or arrange for a redelivery attempt.

Alternatives to Cash on Delivery Shipping

Although cash on delivery shipping is a popular payment method, there are other options that can be considered.

An alternative is payment by invoice. With this method, you receive the goods first and then pay within a specified timeframe. This allows you to inspect the goods before making the payment and ensure they meet your expectations.

Another option is payment by credit card or PayPal. These payment methods enable quick and secure payment and provide additional protection for the customer.

According to a study published by the EHI Research and Education Institute in July of this year, nearly 30 percent of customers made their online purchases through PayPal last year. Thus, the US payment service has surpassed invoice payment (23.8 percent) as the preferred payment method of Germans. Direct debit/bank debit ranks third with 20.9 percent, followed by credit cards with about 12 percent.

Security in Cash on Delivery Shipping

Cash on delivery shipping provides a certain level of security since payment is made upon receipt of the goods. This gives the customer the opportunity to inspect the shipment and ensure it meets expectations.

However, caution is advised as there can be cases of fraud. It is important to verify the order before payment to ensure that no unwanted or unknown shipments are paid for.

item.title: Amazon wants to speed up the customer purchasing process with the help of AI
item.description: The online giant Amazon uses artificial intelligence (AI) to create summaries of product reviews. The aim is to speed up the buying process for customers who are pressed for time and don't want to trawl through countless customer reviews.
item.content:encoded:
Source: https://t3n.de/news/amazons-ki-bewertet-produkte-schlechter-kuenstliche-intelligenz-zusammenfassungen-1597916/

The online giant Amazon employs artificial intelligence (AI) to generate summaries of product reviews. This is intended to expedite the purchasing process for customers who are under time constraints and do not want to sift through numerous consumer reviews.

The advancing development of artificial intelligence has led to a variety of applications that can assist us in various aspects of daily life. This includes E-commerce, where Amazon has developed an AI that creates automated product reviews. However, a recent investigation has revealed that this AI does not reliably fulfill its task, and the disadvantages outweigh the benefits for customers.

The Product Review Summary Function

In 2023, Amazon introduced an AI designed to automatically summarize product reviews, thereby streamlining the purchasing process for customers. The goal of this function is to extract the key points from numerous reviews and highlight the most important aspects of a product in a concise review. Customers are supposed to receive a compact overview, eliminating the need to laboriously read through hundreds of reviews and assisting them in their purchase decision.

Weaknesses in Product Evaluation

However, Bloomberg's investigation reveals that Amazon's AI does not reliably fulfill its task. Analyzing dozens of products, it was found that the AI is unable to appropriately filter and consider the highlights of the reviews. Negative aspects in the reviews are often overemphasized, and overall, positive and negative points of a product are not coherently listed. This leads to a distortion of the overall assessment and can mislead customers.

An example from the investigation involves canning jars. Despite averaging a rating of 4.5 stars, the AI highlighted rust stains on the jars as a negative aspect. However, this aspect was mentioned by only 16 users out of a total of 3000 reviews. Nevertheless, this aspect constituted one-third of the AI summary, resulting in a distorted representation of the product.

Missing or Incorrect Information in AI Summaries

In addition to overemphasizing negative aspects, the investigation also reveals that Amazon's AI sometimes fails to appropriately acknowledge important information in the reviews. For example, a backpack with over 21,000 reviews lacked the mention that inferior material was used for the shoulder straps. There were even instances where the AI turned a fitness device into a desk, rendering the product description inaccurate.

Customers have noticed these weaknesses in Amazon's AI, stating that the function negatively affects holiday sales. Despite this criticism, Amazon rejects the accusations and emphasizes that the AI helps customers find the right products, leading to increased sales. Additionally, the company continuously works on improving the system.

The Challenges in Developing AI Systems

The problems highlighted by the Bloomberg investigation illustrate the current challenges in developing AI systems. Artificial intelligence is not capable of independent thinking but merely complements the most probable next word. This can lead to misinterpretations and distortions, as is the case with Amazon's AI.

AI-generated texts are unable to replace human thinking and judgment. They can only serve as tools to extract and structure information. When using such AI functions, customers should always remain critical and complement the information with their own research and assessments.

item.title: Development of e-commerce in Germany
item.description: Study: EHI and ecommerceDB analyse online retailing
item.content:encoded:
Photo: https://pixabay.com/vectors/ai-generated-e-commerce-shopping-8261529/

The e-commerce sector in Germany, which has long been characterized by steady growth, recorded a decrease in revenue for the first time in 2022. According to a recent study by EHI and ecommerceDB, the top 1,000 B2C online shops experienced a net decrease of 2.8 percent (unadjusted for price), resulting in a loss of 2.2 billion euros, bringing the total revenue down to 77.7 billion euros. This marks the temporary halt of the continuous growth of the German online retail sector, which had extended over a period of 15 years.

Reasons for the Decline in E-Commerce Revenue

The revenue decline in 2022 can be attributed to various factors. On one hand, some online shops are struggling with significant losses, while others are exiting the market for economic reasons. On the other hand, smaller online shops, in particular, have shown significant relative growth. Despite the decline, the overall revenue of the top 1,000 shops remains 1.5 times higher than before the COVID-19 pandemic. Nevertheless, the general consumer sentiment and online purchasing willingness in Germany weakened in 2022, leading to a declining trend.

Growth of Smaller Online Shops and Slight Decrease in Market Concentration

Despite the revenue decline among large online shops, smaller B2C online shops in the lower rankings experienced significant growth of 7.3 percent compared to the previous year. This demonstrates that the German e-commerce market still maintains some diversity. However, the market remains highly concentrated, with the top 100 online shops accounting for more than 70 percent of the total revenue of the top 1,000. Due to the revenue declines in the large online shops, market concentration has slightly decreased. The net e-commerce revenue of this year's top 10 decreased by 9.7 percent compared to the previous year, representing 38.2 percent of the total.

The Top 10 B2C Online Shops in Germany

In the ranking of the top 10 B2C online shops in Germany, there were some changes. While amazon.de and otto.de continue to occupy the first two positions, aboutyou.de entered the top 10 for the first time with a growth of 8.8 percent. Zalando.de maintained its fourth position from the previous year, displacing mediamarkt.de to the third position. In addition, there were two newcomers in the top 20: shop.rewe.de and bestsecret.com. The biggest growth drivers among the top 10 B2C online shops were apple.com (+18.2 percent), breuninger.com (+16.1 percent), and shop-apotheke.com (+15.9 percent).

The Top 10 B2C Marketplaces in Germany

The study also includes a list of the top 10 B2C marketplaces in Germany. In 2022, these marketplaces generated a total revenue of 72.8 billion euros, representing a decrease of 2.4 percent compared to the previous year. Market leader amazon.de maintains its top position with a gross merchandise volume of 46.3 billion euros, followed by ebay.de (9.0 billion euros) and otto.de (6.4 billion euros).

About ecommerceDB and the EHI Research Area E-Commerce

ecommerceDB is a comprehensive database providing detailed information on over 42,000 shops, marketplaces, and companies in more than 59 countries and 18 categories. In addition to revenue and competitor analyses, it also includes information on e-commerce metrics and national e-commerce markets. The EHI Research Area E-Commerce analyzes the German-speaking B2C online trade and hosts EHI Connect, a platform for the exchange and discussion of current e-commerce trends.

For more information about EHI's research and studies, visit https://www.ehi.org/wissen/forschung/

item.title: Refund fraud on the rise: What online retailers should know
item.description: In so-called refund fraud, perpetrators order products on the Internet and later claim to the merchant that they never received the goods, thus obtaining a refund.
item.content:encoded:
So-called reimbursement fraud is becoming a bigger and bigger issue: in a recent online article reports Wirtschaftswoche" about the latest developments and tricks that online retailers should know about. In refund fraud, perpetrators order products on the Internet and later claim never to have received them, thus obtaining a refund from the merchant.

The assessments of the traders are different: While some are not noticing an increase in fraud, according to Wiwo, the Swiss/German tech retailer Galaxus reports an increase, especially since the start of the Corona pandemic. This is plausible, typically electronics assortments are highly susceptible to fraud. Used electronics provider Rebuy, for example, is also said to be strengthening its digital fraud defenses have. According to the Wiwo report, he sees a downward trend in fraud attempts, but notes that credit card fraud is continues to be a problem internationally.

In spring 2021 the Federal Criminal Police Office conducted a raid on seven men suspected of being of belonging to the "German Refund Crew" and of having defrauded online retailers of hundreds of thousands of euros. In some cases, they send back cheaper or older items as returns and keep or sell the more expensive original merchandise. The "German Refund Crew" is said to be in more than. 600 of such cases and offered these Scam even offered in a Telegram group as a service.

A similar case was reported in Dortmund, Germany, where a lone perpetrator targeted online retailers in more than 1.600 cases for a total of 1,5 million Euro has defrauded. Another case involved a Spanish Amazon user who asked the company for 330.000 Euros by buying iPhones ordered, picked up the devices and filled the boxes with soil before sending them back.

The German E-Commerce Association (BEVH) notes that in the year. 2022 increased chargebacks on credit card transactions, especially for amounts under 30 2022 and respectively. 50 Euro. The problem occurs mainly in transactions with buyers from third countries.

Online merchants should be vigilant and use all possibilities of technical protection measures to prevent such fraud attempts from counteract.
